subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
Phonetic borrowing â€“ originally represented a bag tied at both ends (like a cellophane-wrapped candy with the ends twisted), and was later borrowed phonetically to mean â€œeastâ€. This borrowing may have been influenced by reinterpreting the character as the sun ({{zh-l|*æ—¥}}) rising behind a tree ({{zh-l|*æœ¨}}), which is the traditional (though incorrect) etymology, as given in ''{{w|Shuowen}}''.
